alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Merrick; Nance; Polk; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 25 at 8:51AM CST until December 26 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM PEAKS TODAY-TONIGHT BUT CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected at times. Additional snow accumulations mainly between 4 and 7 inches, the majority falling today and tonight. Northwest winds gusting 25 to 35 MPH today, but decreasing to only 15 to 25 MPH tonight into Tuesday. * WHERE...Merrick, Nance, Polk, York, and Hamilton Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although true blizzard conditions with 1/4 mile visibility or less will likely only occur on an occasional basis, snow and blowing snow will frequently reduce visibility to under 1 mile.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle.
